data.title: Great Diner in Vacaville...
data.text: Stopped at the Heritage House Cafe for breakfast on our way to Sacramento. Had Chicken Fried Steak. It was yummy. Great family friendly place. Everything was good and staff is very nice and friendly.

data.title: Hole in the Wall
data.text: Just a little hidden gem in downtown Vacaville. Very good food and seems like the locals are regulars!

data.title: Rustic
data.text: We have now gone to this little gem twice now, and my husband and I love it! Its the wonderful little whole in the wall that has great food. Both times are servers were extremely friendly (something that seems to have died off in the larger restaurant changes). This is the best place to go if you are looking good food, friendly service and a little extra piece of Vacaville history! The have great photos from back in the day as part of their décor...wonderful looking back....The décor is rustic but cute! If your a beer or wine fan they have a large selection...

data.title: Cute Store Front, Old Wall Pictures, Typical Venues!
data.text: Food was nicely prepared, Friendly, nice rest rooms, but very pricey. My wife and I, split up a meal, and with tip, over twenty dollars. A vegetarian omelet, and two drinks. So  beware, left with saying not going to be, "next time," this place is history!!

data.title: great food excellent service
data.text: i fell in love with this eatery the first time. the staff is super friendly, the service is superb and the food is great.

data.title: Reminded me of years ago..
data.text: Upon visiting the Vacaville on business, I decided to walk the downtown area.  This is when I stumbled upon this gem.  Walking in reminded me of years ago, of a restaurant I frequented just to visit with people.  The smell of fresh brewed coffee, the atmosphere and the menu list, was like a flashback into time.  I arrived shortly before closing, as I was unaware of the time, but was treated very nice and they still made my order.  They accidentally left the Bacon off of my sandwich, but was quick to bring me some.  It was overcooked, but I blame that on them trying to close.  The old fashioned egg sandwich on grilled rye was very tasty and the homemade potato chips are fantastic.  The young lady waiting on me was very sweet.  Would return if ever I come back..  thanks..

data.title: "Best Breakfast in Vacaville"
data.text: I would rank the Heritage House #1 breakfast place in Vacaville for 2015.  Been coming in here for years and seen in go through a lot of changes, owners, waitresses and especially cooks. Lots of eateries  go through their ups and downs and this place is no different but the last few times I have eaten here the breakfast food has been outstanding. I came in with the family for my birthday and had a very good breakfast.  My eggs were cooked correctly, hash browns. sausage etc.... The pancake I ordered on the side was plate size and very tasty. I could't finish the entire breakfast. There is nothing fancy here just simple comfort food, cooked correctly, served hot out of the kitchen and that's all I am really looking for. Yea it's and old building with old decor that needs a face lift but for 2015 I have to say they are serving the most consistently good breakfast food in town.

data.title: Since discovering this last month, our new Favoriate
data.text:
Judy and the other staff are wonderful, they feel like family and only after going there twice learned our usual order.

The food is wonderfully reminiscent of the old diners but with a great modern take. The biscuits and gravy are awesome and the menu has a great selection. Try the cheese grits, something rare to find here in Vacaville or nearby.

Kudos to the cook. I see him every weekend when we visit. Amazing food. Hope the word doesn't get out too fast because we love being able to walk right in and get a seat. Small and quaint but wonderful little downtown area, often music across the street.  Our favorite local place!

data.title: Where the locals go.
data.text: Vacaville hometown diner.  Old school interior, prob from the 70's. Love this place for breakfast.  Good portions, good food, good prices.  Servers are friendly. Definately the place locals go.  Even keep specific coffee cups for their regulars. Did I mention that I love this place?

data.title: Good food, lousy service.
data.text: We have been wanting to dine here for a bit.  We heard that it was a great place.  While the food was good, the service was lacking.  We sat for a bit before anyone came by our table. They dropped off menu's, without taking our drink order. Almost 15 minutes later, they came back.  Needless to say, we ordered since we didn't know when they would be back. I watched as the same sever, immediately waited on other new patrons, taking the drink order, right away. They never checked back to see how our food was or if we needed anything. I had to go to the counter to ask to have our drinks refilled. Basically, they need better organization, in the front of the house.  Also, one or two more servers. They are a small and very busy establishment. I will go back again, and I do recommend trying them.  They received the rating I gave due to the terrible service.

data.title: HUGE Pancakes
data.text: I loved the pancake that I ordered. It was bigger than the plate and they added fresh blueberries. The waitress was friendly. It was a little pricey for breakfast but overall it was good.

data.title: Bad Service
data.text: My wife and I went there on Sunday morning. The food was excellent as always. The service was slow. There were 4 tables that didn't get cleaned until the dishwasher came in at 9am. They were dirty for around 30 mins. Also, a customer had to go up to the counter to get a refill on her coffee. They had 2 waitresses working. We have seen the service not improving. The only waitress that has good customer service doesn't come in until 10am. We don't go there as much, because of the service.

data.title: Service
data.text: My wife and I went for breakfast today. The service was the worst that we have ever had. We found a table that was not dirty. The waitress came an took our food and drink order. It took about ten minutes to get our coffee. After we got our food my wife had to send back her food. The waitress said I'll be right back with coffee, ten minutes later we finally got coffee from the other waitress..The other waitress was rolling silverware instead of cleaning the 4 or 5 tables that were dirty. Customers would sit down and the waitress would have to wipe the table, because it was dirty. One customer had to get up and go to the counter for a coffee refill.

data.title: Happy at the Heritage House
data.text: The Heritage House is located in the heart of downtown Vacaville. It has the best breakfast, excellent service and a great atmosphere. When you are finished you can stroll the quaint streets of Vacaville or window shop.

data.title: Service
data.text: My wife and I went there on Monday morning. The food was excellent as always. The service was slow. The waitress didn't come around with the coffee. My cup was empty for over 5 minutes. We had to ask for refills. This is the only waitress were it happens.

data.title: Love the New Owners
data.text: Yummy Breakfasts the Best ever Bacon. Everything has a great taste and with the new owners the Toast is getting buttered completely and cut in half.

data.title: Great breakfast!
data.text: Been a semi-regular for years. This is your typical small-town secret place. Good, hearty breakfast at a reasonable price with great service. And they will go off-menu if asked.

data.title: Great place for breakfast
data.text: Husband and I had breakfast here yesterday.  What a great little restaurant.  We had French toast, and it was fantastic.  The coffee was really good.  Waitress was very attentive, and gave good service.  You won't go wrong choosing this place to eat.

data.title: Throwback Charm
data.text: Stepping into the diner is like stepping back in time. The staff is friendly and homey, the decor is vintage and eclectic and the food is the scrumptious fare of an old greasy spoon... think cheese and butter in generous quantities. You won't go here to find health food, but you will when you want comfort food surrounded by a healthy dose of local culture. A sign on the wall says it all, "Will trade coffee for gossip."
